website_summaries.verdict: This backpacking chair is strong enough to support up to 275 lbs.
pros: Combination of a steel frame and polyester fabric delivers immense stability and versatility
Unique design ensures the chair can be rolled up instantly
Comes with a handy hook-and-loop strap closure
cons: Chair is very small in comparison to similar options

customer_reviews.title: Great camping chair
customer_reviews.text: Great camping chair. I am 265lbs and six feet tall so it works great for me. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: J. HallTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great for when you're mostly mobile but really would rather be sitting
customer_reviews.text: I have this chair hanging on my front door. I am able to grab this when I take the dog out to the back of the property to do his business and play. He and I can also walk over to the creek, him running in and out of the water up and down the bank acting a fool.....me, sitting like the sloth I am in this chair, reading my phone and waiting for him to wear himself out. No haters please - I spoil this dog ALL the time and he isn't even mine. This chair is super lightweight - no worries.
customer_reviews.author: G. Franke

customer_reviews.title: I bought 3 of these chairs. The 2 blacks ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these chairs. The 2 blacks have different rivet where the shoulder ties are. The red has a screw, which is loose all the time. At one point the screen came off when I was sitting. I thought the fabric ripped and the chair folded over. This needs to be QC checked. Update Purchased 2 more black and they changed it to screws. It's definitely tighter.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kim

customer_reviews.title: A mans shopping assistant.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a guy in a household of women. Shopping is my pastime if I want to spend time with my girls. Most stores dont have any place a man can sit and contemplate the massive funds he's about to part with. Therefore I have to bring my own chair. This little stool is my go to shopping trip buddy. I can sit on it comfortably while my wife and daughters spend money like drunken sailors and when they've finally finished it folds up and goes with me to the next wallet slaughtering. It also doubles as a club to fend off the skinny little boys who like to follow along and gawk at my girls.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Handy

customer_reviews.title: Great compact mobile chair
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my senior dog especially likes to sit down mid walk and just relax and observe his surroundings (no yard ). I was sitting on the curb but got funny looks and ants kept biting me. I think I still get funny looks but it’s worth no more ant bites and keeping my bestie happy. I am about 5ft and this chair is compact and mobile enough for me to carry with having my dog on leash also. will also be used for long periods of standing.
customer_reviews.author: Lp

customer_reviews.title: Love the freedom this little stool has given me!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little stool. I can't stand for long periods of time and in the past wouldn't go to events or places where there often was nowhere to sit. This has helped me regain some freedom of being able to go to fun places with my grandson. It's lightweight, and fairly easy to carry around. The one thing I would change if I could would be a longer, adjustable carrying strap that would allow me to carry it over my body on my back. Would make it easier and more comfortable to carry around, otherwise, it's the perfect little tripod seat to take along to places that don't have seating.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Cush

customer_reviews.title: Need a totally portable chair! Great for those long waits at the DMV!
customer_reviews.text: The Good: - Folds up very small and very compact - Very lightweight with should strap - Comfortable to sit even for long periods - Holds up to 275 pounds The Bad: - None The Bottom Line: I’m not sure why I didn’t get one of these sooner. This chair is so portable and pretty comfortable for long periods (2 hours no problem). It’s great for sporting events and I actually just used it while waiting 6 hours at the DMV!
customer_reviews.author: Hoppaguy

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I have a difficult time standing in one place for hours. This seat fits very well and somehow supports my back which can be tricky. I'm 6'1" and 180 lbs. It's easy to open & close and lightweight to carry. I used it on dirt and concrete. Unfortunately my spouse saw me use it and now it disappeared. I would recommend and buy again, which the suspect says I should do if I want one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: D. Korte

customer_reviews.title: TravelChair
customer_reviews.text: I'm with the Honor Guard with A.L 147 in Charleston,SC. At times, there's a wait anywhere from an half an hour, or hour and a half in waiting time. WE stand and wait. Yes, we could sit under the service tent, but we want to ready when the time come to salute the deceased. So, I bought this seat. It's small, easy to carry, also I can kick it away once the command is given! Thank you this seat. And may our VETS REST IN PEACE!!!
customer_reviews.author: VAMPYBITES

customer_reviews.title: Not good for man parts!
customer_reviews.text: Really sturdy and stylish. Would last for years I'm pretty sure. My main complaint is that it is not a good design for anyone with man parts! The three legged design means that, no matter how you sit on it, there is always one leg digging into your crotch! I tried it for less than 5 minutes with large amounts of uncomfortable feelings in my nether reagons the entire time. Especially if you lean forward when sitting at a small stool height. I went for a 4 leg design instead just to save my boys. Save the children people. Get a four legged stool!
customer_reviews.author: Sushibar7

customer_reviews.title: Not ergonomically designed for men's private parts
customer_reviews.text: This camp chair is very sturdy, so I don't want to give them one or two stars. However, I bought this camping chair to make it easier to put my socks and shoes on while tent camping. (I have a bad back) Every time I leaned forward in the chair, the folded upward corners hurt my private area. It honestly wasn't that comfortable even before leaning forward. Keep looking gentlemen. This is not the chair for adult males.
customer_reviews.author: Twelve Drummers Drumming

customer_reviews.title: Good height for a camp stool
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I could stop on my walks and draw flowers, birds and things. It's light with an adjustable strap. It fit my budget and it works great. By the time I've sat down it's 15" from my butt to the ground. I'm 5' 2" I can't imagine trying to sit in the ones that say they are smaller than this. It does measure 17.5" from the seat to the ground when empty. It's not for lounging. It's for taking a load off when needed, or if you don't fancy sitting on the wet ground.
customer_reviews.author: #2 Daughter

customer_reviews.title: Great stool, very lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: This stool is great! Very lightweight, relatively small, quick to set up. I went hiking with it the other day and carried it in my hand the whole time and didn't feel fatigued at all. The only improvement I'd like is if the carry strap were longer and fully detachable. It's too short to comfortably fit over my shoulder (even at full extension) meaning it digs into my shoulder-blade as I walk. I'd also love to be able to sling it diagonally across my back while walking as it'd bounce around less. Still, fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: bobble

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than a log, rock, curb, or concrete wall.
customer_reviews.text: Not super comfortable but more comfortable than a log, rock, curb, or concrete wall. The addition of a small cushion improves it a great deal. But I doubt I'll ever bother. Its very light and very sturdy. I like the height. When I'm sitting on it, the three high spots are 18.5” and the center is 15.5”. I will mostly use it for breaks when I'm working in the woods. Will also use it when I rarely wait in lines or protest something. The strap seems uselessly short but I would always have a day pack when carrying it. I'm 77y, 6', and 245lb.
customer_reviews.author: sul tasto

customer_reviews.title: Portable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This helped me get through an overnight wait in a huge Comic-Con line, without being too bulky to deal with hauling around. It's very portable, feels sturdy, and even though I am not a small person I was not concerned I was going to crush it or fall off. It was a heck of a lot better than sitting on the ground all of the time. I'll be happy to bring it to other events where it would be nice to sit down now and then. Yes, the one male person who sat in it was a little gingerly about it, but he also thought it was better than not having a chair.
customer_reviews.author: riverrat01

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portable tripod seat
customer_reviews.text: this is the perfect portable stool to take a break on. I keep it outside on my porch year round, I do try to keep it from getting consistently rained on. I actually backpacked up a mountain with this and took a couple breaks. I weigh about 190lbs so it is sturdy for my purposes. Comfortable too but I have a pretty big posterior so that factors into my comfort level. I put it on the underside of my backpack and tied it down but this comes with an easy to use and unhook-able shoulder strap. would recommend this for backpacking, floating, or camping
customer_reviews.author: Logan H.

customer_reviews.title: BEST
customer_reviews.text: This was the BEST camping accessory I invested in. It was a foot stool when I was lounging, it was a little seat to be next to the fire without hauling my folding chair around, it was even a little table for my drink when I was getting up and down a bunch. Very sturdy, definitely held up to the weight limit, and I'm glad it had a strap so that I can throw it over my shoulder when loading and unloading a vehicle with all my camping gear. I plan on bringing it with me to events that may not have good seating, and anywhere else I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: Meg L

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair to take to Airventure in Oshkosh Wisconsin for the occasional need to sit down. It worked great for that. Oshkosh had a LOT of rain prior to trip and unfortunately the legs began to sink into the grass. At one point one of the feet got swallowed by the tundra and despite my best efforts - I couldn't find it. I contacted the manufacturer and they sent me a replacement foot under warranty - that is some GREAT customer service. Special shout out to Olivia at TravelChair for her EXCELLENT customer service. I think I will likely put a screw through each of the rubber feet to avoid this in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great compact chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take to a convention, it was great to be able to just pop up a chair wherever there was a line or whenever I needed a break. It was lightweight and very sturdy, I just hooked it to the back of my backpack and carried it with me everywhere. I am 5'9" and about 175lbs and it worked very well and was comfortable for sitting for 20-30 minutes at a time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Petty

customer_reviews.title: Camp Ottoman
customer_reviews.text: I put my feet up on this chair while sitting in my 'real' camp chair. It doesn't adjust or anything, but it does have a strap for carrying (which I've never used). Shape is good for a short squat, hard to imagine using for any extended time as a real seat, though. Not a great camping side table. Make sure all the feet are spread entirely, otherwise it'll topple.
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sturdy, well made, superior leg ends, but small seat
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well made, but heavy, excellent leg ends. Several tripod chairs I have owned for years, the aluminum leg posts have cut through their rubber ends. Used on vinyl floors, you cut the vinyl. I returned this chair because the seat is too small for my medium far ass. Ok to sit on BUT I use both hands pressing down on the seat to aid standing. Seat is too small to easily push up. Oh, some will disagree, in the weight limit. My 250lbs has never caused a problem on other tripods. Personally I will order any tripod chat I like bitter the weight limit.
customer_reviews.author: B. Speer

customer_reviews.title: Does not fold down to newspaper size
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to fold down to fit in my carryon. I have the tag from the Slacker Travelchair right here in front of me which states "Folds down smaller than a rolled up newspaper", maybe a giant's newspaper. We have never seen a newspaper that would be this large. Unless we are missing something, it does not fold down to the size of a newspaper. If it does, please post how to do it on YouTube. This statement is misleading and should be removed from advertising. Otherwise happy with it, but will not be able to use it for the purpose we had hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: PDH

customer_reviews.title: Held up to my 240lbs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for attending a golf tournament to be used for temporary resting. I weigh 240lbs and it was sturdy enough to support me with no problems. I wouldn’t want to spend the day sitting in it but it worked great for a brief rest stop. Easily folded and carried. I thought maybe the leg bottoms would sink into the soft ground, but it does a great job if you stay balanced. I think it would be a great choice for hiking or any other activity where temporary resting would be needed. Compact and light
customer_reviews.author: Dale B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for comic con!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lightweight chair that was comfortable for New York comic con. After rearing some mixed reviews, I decided to give this chair a try. It's very easy to carry and the strap is very useful. I was able to sit wherever I needed at the show which was great for my feet. The only improvement I would suggest is to make the Velcro strap which holds the chair closed a little longer. Otherwise it was great and I plan to use it for other conventions!
customer_reviews.author: Ankur J

customer_reviews.title: Good for a short rest
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for travel purposes. I can walk, but due to sciatica, I can't stand in place for long, so I bought this stool. It came in handy during parts of my travels where I had to wait in line. I found the seat to be a little uncomfortable, but not so much that made it not worth bringing. It's light weight and easy to carry over the shoulder with it's carry strap. The Velcro strap that wraps around the legs, to keep them from unfolding, broke during my trip. Fortunately I didn't loose it and I guess I'll just sew it back on myself.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stable
customer_reviews.text: Depending on the time of day when I'm using this, I tip the scales at nearly 230 pounds. That's when I'm wearing all types of gear. On a different kind of day, I weigh about 170 pounds. Either way, this little chair holds up quite nicely. It's nice to lean it close to something so I can lean back on it when I'm weighing 16 stone or less. It's lightweight and easy to deploy. It just wish it collapsed to something a bit smaller. It's sometimes difficult to pack or find a place for it when I have to carry a bunch of other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Frequency JonesTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Crap!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these stools. I took my daughter to DragonCon last year and picked up 2 of these for us to sit on while waiting for the parade to start. One stool BROKE before we even left the house. The other stool broke after maybe 15 minutes of use. Needless to say, they were returned. I've seen other stools like this on Amazon that actually come with a carabiner, which makes lugging the stools around so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Margot Perry

customer_reviews.title: The Legs Gave Out
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design and weight of this chair. However, my rating go 3 stars comes from the ability to use the chair on anything other than a solid surface. When I tried using my chair on regular ground, the rubber support on the leg came off. A possible fix would be a more pronounced (wide) rubber footing.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Doctor

customer_reviews.title: not  what I anticipated
customer_reviews.text: The fact that this stool had lots of rave reviews plus the low price convinced me to buy it. That was a mistake. Many reviews touted how the buyers' large bodies fit so well and comfortably even over uneven surfaces. I am 5', 100 lbs, and when I put my meager behind on this stool it feels wobbly and unsafe. It has tipped over and in constant danger of doing so again. I deeply regret buying this item.
customer_reviews.author: evaline

customer_reviews.title: Strap really is adjustable!
customer_reviews.text: Good for hiking, camping or anytime you may need a temporary place to sit. Some other comments mentions how short the carry strap is, which I thought too. But if you take a few minutes to figure it out, you’ll find the carry strap really is adjustable and you’ll have plenty of room to throw it over your shoulder. Is not as stable as a 4 legged stool but works fine on mostly level surfaces. My suggestion to the seller is to “adjust” the carry strap to the largest opening before sending it to customers and NOT the smallest opening.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Owens

customer_reviews.title: Little on the small side
customer_reviews.text: Nice light chair. Easy to fold and carry. Honestly it’s not very comfortable. I’m not a real big guy, I’m 6’ and 180lbs. The seat is not quite big enough for me so I kind of have to straddle one of the legs and have the other two poking me in the backside. I’ve seen similar chairs with a bigger seat area, so unless your smaller then get something bigger. Update: Chair was nice and light which made easy to bring but just not comfortable. After using it over a year for various events I left it behind one day and wasn’t even upset. I’ll be shopping for a different chair now.
customer_reviews.author: AverageDad

customer_reviews.title: great quality but the shape of the seat is uncomfortable in certain areas.
customer_reviews.text: Weight, size, and foldability is great. But as a man its slightly uncomfortable... rides a little too high in a certain area and i cant seem to sit any other way to make it comfortable. I will use it for quick sit downs as i get stuff out my pack or cooking. But this is not meant to sit down longer than 15 mins or youll regret it. Overall its what i expected and am pleased with the quality of the build just not comfortable for anything longer than a quick sitdown.
customer_reviews.author: MaseG19

customer_reviews.title: THE ONLY PRODUCT YOU WILL EVER NEED
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the swiss army knife of chairs. You show up to anything, a pig roast, a camping trip, a garage tinkering session, and everyone's just a little jealous of your sweet tiny chair. Maybe it doesn't have a cup holder, but it also doesn't have a stupid bag and it fits in a large purse. If you're in the garage, you just carry it around while you're working, set it in front of whatever and get to work. If you're hiking, you barely notice you're carrying it.
customer_reviews.author: Salvador A. Valdes

customer_reviews.title: Light and sturdy, but can be uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a quality product - lightweight and easy to fold and carry. The downside is that if you are a male, it's very difficult to sit on comfortably. The tripod design means that you end up with one of the legs between your legs. Given that there is no back, you end up leaning forward which creates a "binding" situation that can be quite uncomfortable. One other factor is that the tripod design isn't super-stable on surfaces that aren't flat.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo Stanfield

customer_reviews.title: Handy stool for seniors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take to the DMV where the lines were very long and seating limited. It was God-send. This senior citizen was prepared for the long wait with comfortable seating and ipad. Since then I have found many uses for the stool. I have used it when pruning short bushes in the garden and cleaning and sorting through low drawers in the house. It is very lightweight, comfortable and sturdy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marge V

customer_reviews.title: Good chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a good chair. Breaks down very small (for a chair) and light. I used this for still hunting and added some foam padding to the seat for after two hours of sitting without standing up it can get pretty uncomfortable. Next summer I will be using it even more for sitting around the campfires and many other things where I get to stand up once in a while. Seems very well built without any sign of wear or issues after several days of use for hours each day.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it will do fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of an outdoor painting workshop. I haven't used it for that yet, but it seems like it will do the job. This is not the kind of chair you want to spend hours in lounging by the fire or at the beach, but it's very lightweight and should do well for spending a few hours painting watercolours outdoors. It folds easily, but you have to be careful about where the straps are when you fold it, or you'll have to unfold the chair again to get the straps out of the way and then re-fold it.
customer_reviews.author: February Baby

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for Men . . . . . OUCH!
customer_reviews.text: The seating area of this chair is extremely small and the three corners curve up sharply. This is a big time crotch killer if you're a man . . . . . . OUCH! It seems to be very well made but too small a seating area and not a good design for a male body. I'm only 5'9" and 160 lbs. so my size is not the issue here. More suitable for children or women with nothing to get crushed by the upwards curving corners.
customer_reviews.author: Frank M.

customer_reviews.title: Saved me in Mexico City.
customer_reviews.text: I have Erythromelalgia which is a "hot feet." I'm one of the lucky one's however, and can walk. That being said, if I'm on my feet for too long it can be quite painful. I have to gauge anything I do with how long I'll be on my feet. So when I had a chance to go to Mexico city with my friends, I was nervous. I bought this chair and it saved me. I couldn't take it to the pyramids, however, but I managed okay. If I had to wait for a long time I would whip it out and sit. It's not too heavy, for the most part. The comfort of having it made the trip much nicer.
customer_reviews.author: VL Towler

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I have back issues and when walking or standing for periods of time, my back was bothering me. I was looking for a collapsible stool that I could take on a trip to Israel. It was exactly what I was looking for. Plus it also seemed to support more weight than other models I was looking at. Was easy to pack in my luggage, light weight, durable, and easy to carry from place to place. I always had a place to sit. I now include it as a regular item that goes with me when travelling. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Good for electricians!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cousin as a Christmas present. He is an electrician. He doesn't go camping, but at 6'5" he's pretty tall and has to be consistently bending down to wire power sockets when he's trimming a house, so his back was taking some considerable abuse. This chair is compact enough, it's light, and has a good long strap so that he can easily carry it with him along with all of his tools wherever he is working. It opens up pretty easily and is just low enough so that he can comfortably do his job without it slowing him down. I figured this wasn't the intended purpose of the chair, but it's not just for camping!
customer_reviews.author: Sigrid

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great idea! I bought this for my husband to carry around when he's walking, such as at a car show or museum. He has sciatica problems and has to sit often. This is lightweight and easy to carry. People ask him all the time where he got it and how much it cost because they want one, too. The only improvement on it would be a longer strap to hook over your shoulder. We replaced the one it has with a removable strap from a luggage piece we had. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Sewing Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Super Convenient
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these for use at our daughters' soccer games, since standing around forever can get a bit tiring! My wife was the one who suggested we get them and while I didn't think they'd be sturdy (or comfortable) enough for a big guy like me, I was proven wrong! You simply have to unfold the legs, sit it down and then sit so one of the prong is between your thighs, and it is surprisingly comfortable! We keep these permanently in our trunk and won't go anywhere without them now!
customer_reviews.author: Mookerific

customer_reviews.title: Chair Rpped After Less Than a Dozen Uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tripod stool/chair to use for work in massage therapy. The stool is used as a back up, not our primary stool, so it has only been used about 10 or so times. The usage is by a grown adult, who sits on the stool for about 20 minutes per massage, to get a good angle on massaging the feet and head. When the massage therapist went to use it this last time, the material broke and the leg came through.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to sit on during day-long training that went on for months. I used it once. It just isn't very comfortable. I should mention that I am a slender female, so it wasn't as if I was pushing the limits with this thing. Several other people tried it out, and at the end of the training, I couldn't even give it away.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Hen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and compact
customer_reviews.text: I love this little chair! It'll be perfect to take to comic-cons, so I can sit in line (#allthelines) without taking up much room. It's also fairly light, and definitely compact. I love the cinch on the top to keep everything in place when you're carrying it around. Just what I hoped it would be -- and the blue color is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: mDav

customer_reviews.title: I looked through probably 100 different chairs before settling on this one and I’m very glad I did
customer_reviews.text: We just started playing a new course and it doesn’t have regular bench stops, so a chair became a necessity! I looked through probably 100 different chairs before settling on this one and I’m very glad I did! This thing is a beast! I’m 290 lbs and it supports me without a problem. Very stable, lightweight and durable construction. The strap sure comes in handy as well! Great buy at an excellent price!
customer_reviews.author: Cary D. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great for golf tournaments
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these chairs to watch my son jr golf tournaments. They are light and well built. I give it a4 star because the shoulder strap was shorter then i would like it to be. It will go over your shoulder fine but it is a little right if you go over cross ways over your shoulder. Great product and have already recommended it to other Patrons watching the golf tournaments with me.
customer_reviews.author: Laker3593

customer_reviews.title: So-so quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair. It’s the perfect height. It’s reasonably comfortable. UPDATE: I originally wrote that it appeared to be high-quality, I have to retract that statement to a degree. I’m having an issue where the screws which hold the legs to its base keep coming out on their own. It is really frustrating to have to keep screwing them back in every third time that I go to use it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Comfort. Heavy Duty Construction. I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Just got my chair 10 minutes ago. Haven't tried it out yet, but I'm already impressed. The height is perfect (measure where you sit comfortably, and check the seat height, not the measurements, before you order any stool). Very comfortable! And the construction is heavy duty!!! Wonderful heavy duty nylon cloth (I used to work in a backpacking store). I have a pinched nerve in my back, and never know when I'll have to turn around on a hike, or just rest for awhile. I think this may work!!! So excited!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: several good uses then needs work
customer_reviews.text: after a few months of some light camping, the screws started to come undone on their own. I screwed them back in and tightend them a bit more but every so often they would come out again. I had to superglue them in a fashion so they would stop coming undone. But now the fabric is starting to give some wear as well. For the price its not that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: For health reasons I've used these type chairs for many years, but I decided to "upgrade" to this finer quality chair...although it really didn't cost more than the lesser quality chairs I've been using. This chair is much better quality than I had expected. It's constructed strong and tight and will last a lot longer than my other chairs, and they were fairly good. Highly recommend. You're sure to be pleased. Fair price. Quick delivery. An all around good bargain. Many thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Martini

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Was great for the eclipse!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly comfortable for being seated a good long period of time. The frame is light even if the carrying strap is a bit on the short side. Both my wife during the eclipse and my brother during a tailgate after a Spartan race commented on how comfortable it was. I absolutely do not regret this purchase and would highly recommend for any hikers, picnickers, tailgaters, photographers, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Size, Weight, and Quality made this a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Light, Compact and simply enough to set up in tight/small spaces...used on the movie set of Jurassic Park, and it was perfection to have on hand for long hours in jungle surroundings...bonus is it truly was small and light enough I could strap to my backpack and ride my motorcycle! I'm 5'5" and 130lbs...a couple guys used it, but no one over 6'1 or 200lbs, so not sure how it would fair for those much larger...I personally found it very sturdy and felt safe on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Great little chairs for travel and backpacking (even though they are heavier than ideal for backpacking chair they suffice). Generally comfy until a certain point when you need to stand up. But it's nice to be off the ground or or if you want more support than sitting on a log. Bummed one of the bottoms of the leg broke off after a few uses, but still functional.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Olson

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy little seat
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little stool. Sitting in it is ok, though i personally would not enjoy using it for more than 20 mins or so without back support, but its comfortable enough. What i use it for and find it a perfect for is to rest your legs on while sitting in another chair. The height is about right and one leg fits right inside it very nicely as you rest your other leg on top. So imo its great for that use and as an additional seat in a pinch
customer_reviews.author: D. Langhorne

customer_reviews.title: COMPANY STANDS BEHIND ITS' PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and portable but screws were always loosening and falling out and now the plastic hub is cracking. Used only occassionally over a 14 month period, more so recently as I am a school crossing guard with sciatica and standing for long periods is uncomfortable ( BTW the kids think it is cool). Anyway I contacted the company and sent photos and even though it is a couple months beyond the warranty they are sending me a new chair. This company is one that now has my allegiance and one I will buy from in the future
customer_reviews.author: William Bray

customer_reviews.title: I love these stools! Sturdy, Lite, & Useful! Great value!
customer_reviews.text: The weight could be less but what you lose in the excess weight, you gain in sturdiness and value. The price is great and these things are comfortable and feel solid. They use a ton of layers of fabric to reinforce where the poles go into the seat. If you take care of it it will last you forever. These are great for taking to my kids Little League games, picnics, camping, or just throw them in the car in case you need them. They double as foot stools too!
customer_reviews.author: OD

customer_reviews.title: Better And More Comfortable Than Others
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. 1st - It's well made. 2nd - It's not too low to the ground. 3rd - It's very comfortable. 4th - It's better than others I've tried including REI. 5th - It's more sturdy than others. If you're a large person, you may not like it, but if you're a normal size person; you will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go to the Macy's Parade. I've been before and knew bringing a big chair doesn't work. These were perfect. Very lightweight and easy to carry. I've used it also for taekwondo tournaments when there aren't enough chairs for spectators. I keep them in my car ready to go when I need them. They are comfortable and sturdy too!
customer_reviews.author: elirod04

customer_reviews.title: Little stool is a life saver!
customer_reviews.text: This little stool is fantastic. Works great for me. I have bad leg weakness that comes and goes. So I take this stool where ever I go. If I go grocery shopping and my legs give out, I open up my stool and sit for about 10 minutes and then my legs get better so I can walk some more. If I didn't have it I probably won't leave the house much at all.
customer_reviews.author: jmhward

customer_reviews.title: As described; useful
customer_reviews.text: Just as expected. I would remark that the packaging was RIDICULOUS! It came in a box 5x larger than it had to be. I thought they had accidentally sent me a baby elephant.
customer_reviews.author: Joan M. Winsor

customer_reviews.title: Great for a dire need situation
customer_reviews.text: This chair has helped me out at work on sets when there is no seating available. Easy to pop out and use~ fairly comfortable as long as you straddle the thing correctly.... I offered to let someone try it out and she said it felt like sitting on the toilet haha! I find it is okay though. I worry about all the reviews I read about the loose screws, but hasn’t happened to me yet after a month of use. Strap could be longer as it is slightly awkward to carry, but another reviewer mentioned purchasing a separate extra-long camera strap and clamping that one on~ I may try that method.
customer_reviews.author: Helene N.

customer_reviews.title: TravelChair Slacker Chair...
customer_reviews.text: This chair, or stool is a better description for the product, is perfect for camping while wanting to save weight. It’s comfortable for a normal sized adult and/or a child. Great for taking a rest without having to splay out all over the ground, but if you’re wanting to lean back and relax, you’ll want a normal fold out chair. Great for moving and sitting, moving and sitting.
customer_reviews.author: chuckntx

customer_reviews.title: Dry high quality. Price is great.
customer_reviews.text: We carry this to watch High School golf. Very light weight and super easy to carry around. I wish the strap was a little bigger for cross body carry but then it would be tangled a lot. It adjusts but just not big enough for anything but one should. It’s light weight so no pain from that just would like it out of the way and on my back sometimes. We never leave home without one or two in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Eikenberry

customer_reviews.title: Goldilocks syndrome-- never-ending search for the right seat.
customer_reviews.text: The chair is well made, lightweight, and easy to set up (a few seconds). But as others have warned, the seat area is very small. I'm an average size person - not heavy. But the seat, after more than 10 minutes, is just uncomfortable. I bought this for doing watercolor sketches on the street, but will need to sit for an hour... and I think this seat is simply too uncomfortable. By the way, the shoulder strap is adjustable, and works fine for carrying over the shoulder. I just ordered the Ezoutdoor Mesh chair (lightweight and has a back). I will write a review on that one when it arrives. This one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: singer-songwriter

customer_reviews.title: Quality seats, but not for sitting for any long period of time.
customer_reviews.text: This chair works fine and appears to be well-made. Taller than other three legged chairs that we have. That's a plus for sitting down because you sit higher, but not great because they are taller and more bulky to carry with you. I thought perhaps they'd be slightly more comfortable than the really cheap ones we already own. They are not. These are really short-term seats, as they are still uncomfortable for sitting for any period of time. Returned, given that they are not any more comfortable than the really cheap versions we already own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Needs reinforced stitching
customer_reviews.text: This may be a manufacturer defect. It appeared to be well made. However, the strap came detached. Then the corner On the same side came unraveled. It looks like the stitching wasn’t reinforced. Because it came apart at the seams. In concept it would have worked well. I bought it to use as my mobile chair for massage. The strap made this easy to carry. Plus it folds up nicely. It was easy to return the damaged item. They offered me an exchange but I wanted to do some more research first.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Light And Easily Portable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to have a light and portable chair for slow Disc Golf play. Some rounds take 3 hours and all that standing hurts my back. This chair is working perfectly to sit and wait for my turn to tee off. It is not all the comfortable for long sessions but for 15 or 20 minutes at a time, it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: jomebrew

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT HANDPAN STAND!
customer_reviews.text: For all my Fellow Hand pan players looking for a stand to put your instrument on. THIS WORKS PERFECTLY! Ive got a 17 inch GUDA steel tongue drum from Zen percussion and it sits on here great! Nice and sturdy! and it also is great for an outdoor seat to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: Syid

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for kayak camping
customer_reviews.text: Unwrapped it and gave it a test. Great chair with plenty of seat for my size. While searching out a camp stool, I found this to be the tallest I could find. It will work for me ok, but my bad knees would like something higher. Overall a great product for it's height and size. Like the weight limit!
customer_reviews.author: Rich6973

customer_reviews.title: Held me up
customer_reviews.text: Im using this for SMPW in so i do a lot of volunteer work next to carts. I have to stand unless i have a chair. This allows me to take some pressure of my back and feet. I like it. Im 6ft and 230 pounds. Weight capacity is 275. Ive only used once but it help up! I still gingerly sit down bc i dont want to fall off, but its supportive. I even test it to rock back in forth in it and it doesnt collapse. Wish it was lighter and more compact but it prolly would make it less sound for weight.
customer_reviews.author: Ansley

customer_reviews.title: EASY to fold, Sturdy as heck, Fits on my CamelBak
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! The Stool Folds up super easy and is very sturdy. Got some good use out it the last week and plan to use it much more. I'm hoping the screws hold up well! Definitely worth the purchase! I got it in Green
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: So handy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This chair has come through in a pinch as a computer chair, a keyboard chair, a camping chair, and a festival chair. I'm 5'10" 145 lbs and never feel wobbly or unstable sitting in it. The strap attached makes it super easy to carry, and everyone is always so shocked when they sit on it and realize it's actually quite comfy!
customer_reviews.author: Avery Heimann

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking and Fishing Chair on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair for hike-in fishing. I just strap it to my fishing backpack it weights very little. It feels very strong and sturdy. The stability isn't the best in the world but what can you expect the footprint is very small which is another nice thing, you can sit nearly anywhere that has a 1 foot by 1 foot flat surface.
customer_reviews.author: Josh G

customer_reviews.title: Good, basic chairs
customer_reviews.text: We didn't have a huge budget for camping supplies, so we bought these for the kids. They are perfect for a quick and easy seat; not so much for extended sitting. They have lasted through packing and unpacking a dozen times with no problems at all. They are strong enough for a medium-sized adult, but not terribly comfortable. They don't tip over, even though they don't have a wide base. Good for budget chairs!
customer_reviews.author: k_overseas

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea, poor execution - for an adult
customer_reviews.text: Cool idea, poor execution - for an adult, at least. It's not particularly comfortable to sit on for any sort of prolonged period of time. If I had been walking all day long and just wanted to sit down, I might use this, but... I'd almost prefer a rock, instead. Works great as a mini-table while camping, though. Holds my tablet well so I can watch a movie.
customer_reviews.author: CheeriosTM

customer_reviews.title: I reinforced pivot ring with 3" hose clamp
customer_reviews.text: Product is as advertised. Seems sturdy, but I reinforced the ring with a 3-4" hose clamp as suggested by other reviewers, and covered the hose clamp with black electrical tape. Now I don't worry about it cracking and collapsing. Carrying straps are extendable, I don't have the problem that others have with it not being long enough. Maybe I am not as big as others. Height is perfect for my needs (approx. 17" to bottom of seat). All seams seem to be well stitched and no issues with them separating so far.
customer_reviews.author: S. K.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up, pack up, and carry. I have a real bad back and can’t stand for long. I use this when I go to concerts, camping and hiking. I play guitar and it comes in very handy for me. With my bad back I can use this when I have to be in long lines and can’t stand for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use as foot stools in our camper. They can be put in a closet when not in use. They are lightweight. We even took them to an outside music concert. We've used them outside, be careful if the ground is muddy because they will sink in. What would you expect with a 200lb person sitting on it. They are very well made and I like the carry strap. Very handy and convenient. My daughter in law has one for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Magic

customer_reviews.title: Convenient little stool when you’re stuck waiting!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stool because my 78 year old dad loves to shop Harbor Freight and Northern Tool. He is slow as molasses and wants to touch and study everything. We are usually there for 2 hours each visit. My back can’t take it. I just sit on my stool and let him enjoy his outing. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Outdoors/Fishing!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased in summer of 2014. I can attest for build quality because it still functions as new minus some dents. It is extensively use every summer and fall on my fishing adventures. After a long trek to my favorite spot, and getting set up, it's nice to have a place to rest and wait for that big bite. Portable and very lightweight. A recommended buy for just about anything! If you find this review helpful, please click 'helpful' button at the end of this product review. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: CTN412

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 185 lbs and feel this chair holds my weight well. It's also very easy to carry. I usually keep it in my car for those occasions outside the house when I expect to be standing for a while. I think it's a great seat for wildlife photographers who sit for hours waiting for animals to appear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this daily as I am regularly working on underground cable lines. Comfortable to sit in for extended periods and seems to be holding up well. Will update if any issues but I don’t anticipate any. The only issue I had is that the feet sink into the dirt sometimes if it’s a little soft but they don’t usually sink deep and it’s a minor issue for the convenience it adds
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 8 months of light use.
customer_reviews.text: Too bad it didn’t last one year- I’m very disappointed. I weigh well under 200 lbs and this shouldn't have happened. Cheaply made, shoddy construction where the seams support most of the person's weight. An accident waiting to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly H

customer_reviews.title: Good quality little chair!
customer_reviews.text: I got a couple of these to bring hiking. Just the thing to throw in a pack or carry over your arm to the beach or wherever! I can hike LONGER now that I can sit and take the weight off my creaky knees! Sitting on the ground doesn't work for me...I am pleased with the price and construction. Not heavy to carry at all!
customer_reviews.author: Drumgal

customer_reviews.title: (☞゚ヮ゚)☞
customer_reviews.text: Go camping without one and I promise, you will be leaving 5 stars too. This chair is small and light enough to stow in a pack, and provides the perfect amount of rest support when stopping anywhere. I'm a fat guy. 275lbs. I sat on it too. These little mothers are strong as hell. Don't stress with the size, it serves its purpose. Sure you can buy a cheaper chair, but the size of this one is why it is priced higher. Go ahead, carry that parade sized chair 5 miles through the woods, and then in a canoe.
customer_reviews.author: Stefen von Horten II

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfortable and really lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, lightweight, sturdy tripod stool that is surprisingly comfortable. The canvas is dense, stiff and water resistant. The velcro close is useful to keep the legs together and the carrying sling is really useful. The only thing this is missing is a cover/bag to go over the stool to keep it clean and keep stuff from getting tangled in the legs when you're packing gear or storing it. They should sell a cover, I'd buy it. The stool is definitely five stars, four stars for the missing cover.
customer_reviews.author: Green Zinnias

customer_reviews.title: C
customer_reviews.text: It’s sturdy, light weight and easy to fold, but after sitting for awhile, my *ss goes numb and that numbness spreads to my legs. I have to stand often to get the blood flowing again to prevent nerve damage...... Buying another chair. If you have any recommendations please let me know. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: A great little stool
customer_reviews.text: This was for one of my daughter's bridesmaids who has trouble standing for long periods of time. We were moving around so much on the wedding day that we wanted her to have the ability to sit down at any point in time. This was a good fit - comfortable and lightweight with a nice carrying strap. I'm glad we had it.
customer_reviews.author: Brea

customer_reviews.title: Functioned, broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: This chair was bought for my son to use while attending a week long scout camp. It broke on the second night, and was not used roughly. My son weighs 80 lbs, so it wasn't bearing a heavy load. My husband thinks he might be able to repair it, but hasn't been able to investigate thoroughly yet. I still awarded 3 stars though because we may have received a faulty chair. I ordered two at the same time, the other was red and did not break. My husband used the red chair and it held up fine.
customer_reviews.author: cynb

customer_reviews.title: This is made my life so much easier.
customer_reviews.text: I get dropped off at the bus stop for my ride home. And sometimes awake could be anywhere from 30 minutes to 40 to 50 minutes. I'm in my sixties and on a cane so standing for that amount of time is absolutely miserable. Now sit on my little chair and pull out a book and the time flies by. It's dirty. I never feel like I'm going to fall. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chair is handy!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased w/the chair for the cost. It's so handy to carry & I use not just outside, just all kinds of times I am able to use it. I am disabled & so to get down low can be difficult. Also wanted to add that I've been buying from Amazon since early 2000's & never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Stronger and more comfortable than expected
customer_reviews.text: The chair is surprisingly sturdy, didn’t feel weak at all holding 260lbs worth of mandog. It’s more comfortable than I would have thought based on the appearance too. The only downside is a bit of an awkward size to carry; not big enough to use the shoulder strap and and not small enough to tuck into something else easily.
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a trip to the many ancient temples in Egypt. There is a lot of walking and I’m an amputee who uses a prosthetic leg. This chair was perfect. It fit in my checked bag and was easy to carry with me during the tours.
customer_reviews.author: steve frishcorn

customer_reviews.title: ultra portable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stool to take in to the field when I go out to paint. It is very sturdy and amazingly light weight! I have bigger folding umbrellas. Fits in a backpack but has a shoulder strap, which my 3 yr old grandson appreciates when he carries it for me. Have also found it useful when I anticipate a long wait in line at ticket box office or stores. I use it for tasks close to the ground instead of kneeling. I am going to buy more of these little gems as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Wheels

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, poor implementation
customer_reviews.text: As others have experienced - upon sitting, the stitching that supports one of the three legs came loose because the thread had not pierced all of the layers well enough. Just shoddy workmanship, but for the price, I didn't expect much. I bought an upholstery sewing kit with heavy duty cord and reattached all of the layers. I also added some support stitches around the other two legs. It's disappointing to purchase something and have to repair/reinforce it upon first use... but it works now. If it had arrived sewn correctly, I would have given it 5 stars, because the concept is great. Size is great, lightweight, shoulder strap for carrying, very useful. Just be prepared for sewing.
customer_reviews.author: ELC

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight and easy to carry and setup
customer_reviews.text: I take it our for wildlife photography on the beach and it's super light, fits easily in a mesh pocket on my backpack and works well enough for the couple of hours I use it. The seat is small so not the most comfortable, but it's better than hauling something heavier around. If you need it for more than an hour or two I would suggest something more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: If this seat was a ballet, it would be called The Nutcracker.
customer_reviews.text: Small and uncomfortable. I just set it up next to my comfortable chair for something to set my beer on now. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: dane714

customer_reviews.title: I use this folding camp chair to do Plein Air ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this folding camp chair to do Plein Air painting. My gear goes into a back pack, my folding chair and a folding table is lashed onto the pack. Off I go, Over hill and dale. I was painting in a strong Colorado wind the other day and it kept me upright, can't say the same for my palate. I weigh close to 200 pounds and have no problems setting for several hours. This would make a all around stool for , hunting camping and painting.
customer_reviews.author: David George

product_meta.title: TravelChair Slacker Chair, Super Compact, Folding Tripod Camping Stool
product_meta.description: The TravelChair Slacker tripod stool is a lightweight camp chair that folds down small, is easy to set up, and is the perfect blend between comfortable, portable and durable. Perfect for camping, a day at the beach, an outdoor concert, fishing, hunting, golfing, or to keep in your car just-in-case, the Slacker weighs only 1.9 lbs. but can hold up to 275 lb. weight capacity. Designed for ease in traveling, the Slacker chair is no bigger than a rolled-up newspaper when folded and secured with its integral Velcro strap. Its frame is constructed from extra-heavy tubing and is coated in an exterior, rust-resistant powder. The double-coated PU-backed polyester fabric will not fade or degrade in the sun and is stretch, tear, and abrasion-resistant. The fabric also distributes weight evenly, making sitting on this folding travel chair quite comfortable. This stool has high-quality nylon connectors and powerful rivets to provide stability. The Slacker features oversized, nylon feet to prevent the chair from sinking into sand or other soft surfaces. The Slacker is lab-tested to ensure its strength and durability. The TravelChair Company cares about making a chair that is strong, durable, and convenient for your on-the-go lifestyle.
feature_bullets: DURABLE FABRIC: The Slacker is engineered with durable Nailhead fabric and 600d Ripstop polyester for dependability on and off the trail.
DURABLE FRAME: The Slacker is reinforced throughout its frame to provide a reliable and long-lasting stool.
LIGHTWEIGHT AND STRONG: Designed for durability and efficiency, the Slacker weighs in at only 2.2 pounds, yet supports up to 275 pounds.
COMPACT STORAGE: The Slacker folds to the size of a rolled-up newspaper, taking up less space and making travel easier on the busy camper.
SIMPLE CLOSURE: Includes an integrated velcro strap for easy storage and packing while on the go.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
